1.name: Joshua Gordon
1.title: Developr Advocate
1.shortBio: Josh Gordon is a Developer Advocate at Google working on TensorFlow.
1.bio: Josh Gordon is a Developer Advocate at Google working on TensorFlow. He’s interested in teaching and computer science education. He can often be found exploring central park on his bike.

2.title: Chrome Developer Relations
2.shortBio: Jeff is a member of the Chrome Web Developer Relations team at Google.

3.name: Yufeng Guo
3.title: Developer Advocate, Google Cloud Team
3.bio: Yufeng has been building computers since elementary school and lives at the intersection of hardware and software. As a Google Developer Advocate, Yufeng bridges the gap between the developer community and engineering teams.  He is interested in combining IoT devices, big data, and machine learning, and loves learning new technologies.

4.name: Leigh Scherrer
4.title: Web Developer & Instructor

4.bio: Web Developer, Teacher, & Lover of Most Things JavaScript and Ruby

6.name: Sophie DeBenedetto
6.title: Web Development Instructor,
6.bio: Web developer and teacher, always looking for the next bug to squash, always working to give my students the love of that chase. Areas of interest include Ruby on Rails, Ember, React + Redux. Dabbles in Elixir and Phoenix.

7.name: Chris Gaun
7.title: Cloud Technologies Expert
7.shortBio: Physics nerd turned tech geek at Apprenda and rocking Kubernetes
7.bio: Physics nerd turned tech geek at Apprenda and rocking Kubernetes. He formerly worked as an analyst at Gartner covering public IaaS.

8.name: Isaac Arias
8.title: Cloud Technologies Expert
8.shortBio: Ike Arias runs global team of engineers at Apprenda. His team of developers solely focus on contributing to upstream Kubernetes.
8.bio: Ike Arias runs global team of engineers at Apprenda. His team of developers solely focus on contributing to upstream Kubernetes.

9.name: Faisal Abid
9.title: Google Developer Expert, Web Technologies
9.shortBio: Faisal is a Google Developer Expert, Entrepreneur and Engineer. He is a programming language enthusiast and loves solving software engineering challenges across the stack.
9.bio: Faisal is a Google Developer Expert, Entrepreneur and Engineer. He is a programming language enthusiast and loves solving software engineering challenges across the stack.

10.name: Mike Nakhimovich
10.title: Senior Android Engineer
10.shortBio: Google Developer Expert (Android). Android Developer @New York Times
10.bio: Google Developer Expert Android, Android Developer @New York Times, CoFounder of http://friendlyrobot.nyc : NY's friendliest Android dev shop.

11.name: Murat Yener
11.title: Android Geek & Google Developer Expert
11.shortBio: Code geek, Open Source committer, Java Champion and Google Developer Expert (Android) working at Intel
11.bio: Murat Yener is a code geek, open source committer, Java Champion and Google Developer Expert on Android, who is working at Intel as an Android developer. He is the author of Expert Android Studio and Professional Java EE Design Patterns books from Wiley. He has extensive experience with developing Android, Java, web, JavaEE, and OSGi applications, in addition to teaching courses and mentoring. Murat is an  Eclipse committer and one of the initial committers of the Eclipse Libra project. Murat has been a user group leader at GDG Istanbul since 2009, organizing, participating, and speaking at events. He is also a regular speaker at major conferences such as DroidCon, JavaOne and Devoxx.

12.name: Liam Spradlin
12.title: Design Lead, Touchlab
12.shortBio: Design Lead, TouchLab. Google Developer Expert
12.bio: Design Lead, TouchLab. Google Developer Expert

14.name: Frank Van Puffelen
14.title: Developer Advocate, Firebase
14.bio: Software Engineer & Developer Advocate, Google Firebase Team

15.name: Andreas Mueller
15.title: Research Engineer, Machine Learning Author, scikit-learn Core Developer
15.company: Center for Data Science at NYU
15.shortBio: Author, 'Introduction to Machine Learning with Python', sci-kit learn core contributor and lecturer at Data Science Institute, Columbia University
15.bio: Andreas is a lecturer at the Data Science Institute at Columbia University and author of the O'Reilly book 'Introduction to machine learning with Python', describing a practical approach to machine learning with python and scikit-learn. He is a core developer of the scikit-learn machine learning library, and has been co-maintaining it for several years. He's also a Software Carpentry instructor. In the past, he worked at the NYU Center for Data Science on open source and open science, and as Machine Learning Scientist at Amazon

16.name: Israel Ferrer Camacho
16.title: Android Engineer
16.shortBio: Israel has been developing Android apps since Cupcake. He is really interested in building reusable, testable and maintainable code, without forgetting to delight users with Material design experiences. Israel is currently working as Android developer at Twitter.

17.name: Lex Dreitser
17.title: Founder
17.shortBio: Lex is an award winning VR/AR developer, founder of VRVU, and host of the Build-Run podcast.
17.bio: Lex is an award winning VR/AR developer. Over 90% of Virtual Reality is made with Unity®. Lex is likely the foremost Unity® expert in NYC. When he’s not deep in code, developing the future of VR/AR for major brands, he runs NYC VR University – an official Unity® meetup where he and his team teach the community how to make VR and AR for free. He hosts a 360 video podcast for Unity® developers called Build and Run Build-Run.com. Join him on VRathon.com, an episodic iterative VR hackathon where you’re able to participate through 360 video.

18.name: Donn Felker
18.title: Google Developer Expert
18.shortBio: Co-Host of the Fragmented Podcast. Lead instructor at Caster.IO. International Speaker on topics of Android and more. Author of multiple Android Books. Loves Chipotle and donuts.
18.bio: Co-Host of the Fragmented Podcast. Lead instructor at Caster.IO. International Speaker on topics of Android and more. Author of multiple Android Books. Loves Chipotle and donuts.

19.name: Westbrook Johnson
19.title: Front End Developer
19.shortBio: Westbrook leads front end development at PhotoShelter where he and his team work to bring modern products to wide array of photographer and organizational user looking to manage media assets in the cloud.
19.bio: Westbrook leads front end development at PhotoShelter where he and his team work to bring modern products to wide array of photographer and organizational user looking to manage media assets in the cloud. With the advent of web components he envisions a revolution of new first class elements that make building high quality web experiences easier and faster than ever before. When he's not coding, you'll probably find him in front of a music stand with his trombone, or slurping a delicious bowl of ramen with him lovely wife.

20.name: Oscar Perez
20.title: Software Engineer II
20.shortBio: Software Engineer at Condé Nast's Digital Strategies and Initiatives department. Student in the Georgia Tech's OMSCS program.
20.bio: Oscar is a Software Engineer at Condé Nast. In the past he has worked at BlackBerry and a couple startups. Oscar has experience in desktop, mobile, and web development. He's also working on his Master's degree at Georgia Tech. While away from work/school, he's often found at the gym.

21.name: Michael Solati
21.title: Meteor & Angular Developer
21.shortBio: Michael Solati is a Meteor and Angular developer with a love for Google tech. He works at a web shop in New Haven called Checkmate Creations while also is the organizer for GDG New Haven.
21.bio: Michael Solati is a Meteor and Angular developer with a love for Google tech. He works at a web shop in New Haven called Checkmate Creations while also is the organizer for GDG New Haven.

22.name: Juarez Filho
22.title: Google Developer Expert
22.shortBio: Juarez is passionate about traveling and also to tell his adventures with Web Technologies and Google Products.
22.bio: Juarez is passionate about traveling and also to tell his adventures with Web Technologies and Google Products. He joined the Google Developers Group program in 2014 and in 2016 got a Google Developer Expert nomination to help communities to learn, discover and have fun with Web Technologies.

23.name: Sree Sreenivasan
23.title: Chief Digital Officer, NYC
23.shortBio: Sree Sreenivasan is Chief Digital Officer of NYC. Sree works with startups and tech companies to help them thrive in the world’s greatest city.
23.bio: Sree Sreenivasan is Chief Digital Officer of NYC, and started in his new position on Oct 17, 2016. In announcing his role, Mayor Bill deBlasio (@NYCMayor) tweeted, “Welcome, @sree, as NYC’s new CDO! And onward to becoming the most tech-friendly, transparent, digitally equitable city in the world.” Sree works with City agencies and colleagues throughout the five boroughs to fulfill the goals laid out in that tweet and also works with startups and tech companies to help them thrive in the world’s greatest city. Before coming to City Hall, Sree spent three years as Chief Digital Officer of The Met and also worked for 21 years at Columbia University, teaching digital media at Columbia Journalism School and a year as the university’s first CDO. In 2015, he was named to Fast Company’s list of the 100 most creative people in business and in 2009 to Ad Age’s list of 25 people to follow on Twitter.

24.name: Ben Milton
24.title: Junior Developer
24.shortBio: Junior Developer on the Vogue team at Condé Nast.
24.bio: Ben is a Junior Developer on the Vogue team at Condé Nast. He has experience in Javascript web development and has worked at a small e-comm startup and as a legislative analyst. Away from work, he is likely enjoying a bacon cheeseburger and a (relatively) affordable scotch.

25.name: Wesley Chun
25.title: Google Developer Advocate
25.shortBio: Google Developer Advocate, Bestselling Author 'Core Python'
25.bio: MSCS. Author of Prentice Hall's bestselling 'Core Python' series, Co-author 'Python Web Development with Django'. Developer Advocate at Google. Principal at CyberWeb (cyberwebconsulting.com), a consultancy specializing in Python training. Wesley has over 25 years of programming, teaching, and writing experience, including being one of the original engineers of Yahoo!Mail. He holds degrees in CS, Math, and Music from the University of California. Wesley is a Fellow of the Python Software Foundation.

26.name: Wilson Lee
26.title: Software Engineer
26.shortBio: Android & Front-End Web Developer at Broadway.com
26.bio: Wilson is a developer at Broadway.com, focusing on web front-end and Android development. He is passionate about bringing together complex data and intuitive UI on web and mobile platforms. Away from work, he is an avid fan of musical theatre and comic books.

27.name: Antonino Rau
27.title: Software Architect
27.shortBio: Software Architect & Technology Manager at Conde Nast
27.bio: Technical Architect specialized in Content Intelligence with expertise in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Object Oriented Analysis and Design.

28.name: Jeffrey Smith
28.title: Manager, Tech at x.ai
28.shortBio: Jeff Smith builds large-scale artificial intelligence systems and the teams behind them. He is a frequent speaker, blogger, and the author of Reactive Machine Learning Systems.
28.bio: Jeff Smith builds large-scale artificial intelligence systems and the teams behind them. He is a frequent speaker, blogger, and the author of Reactive Machine Learning Systems, an upcoming book on how to build real world machine learning systems using functional programming, the actor model, and cartoon animals.

29.name: Cesar Anton Dorantes
29.title: Google Developer Expert (Web/Apps)
29.shortBio: Google Developer Expert from LatAm, Analytics Technology Consultant @NBC Universal & Senior Software Engineer @ EPAM. Technical Writer, passionate about web technologies, drones and alternative energy sources.
29.bio: Google Developer Expert from LatAm, Analytics Technology Consultant @ NBC Universal & Senior Software Engineer @ EPAM. Technical Writer, passionate about web technologies, drones and alternative energy sources.

30.shortBio: Jack of all trades at Sketchfab, Craft beer enthusiast, Pokémon master.
